So weâ€™re trying to simulate our robot using AdvantageScope but weâ€™re getting these errors when we try to simulate it. The simulation GUI also immediately closes.

PS C:\Users\robotics\Downloads\NauticalNonsense>  ${env:HALSIM_EXTENSIONS}='C:\Users\robotics\Downloads\NauticalNonsense\build\jni\release\halsim_gui.dll;'; ${env:PATH}='C:\Users\robotics\Downloads\NauticalNonsense\build\jni\release;C:\Windows\system32\'; & 'C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk\bin\java.exe' '-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=n,suspend=y,address=localhost:57475' '@C:\Users\robotics\AppData\Local\Temp\cp_872bmg0ghxpq7ed785zi2bijg.argfile' 'frc.robot.Main'

this.modules is null.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-25T22:42:09.043Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":493225,"topic_slug":"simulation-failing","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡±"},"post_url":"/t/simulation-failing/493225/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3540412,"name":"Justin Spurlock","username":"Snake51","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T22:50:23.056Z","cooked":"

We donâ€™t have a this.modules at line 173 though, instead we have SwerveModulePosition[] positions = new SwerveModulePosition[modules.length];

This line is under our getPositions function for our swerve modules, and the errors started appearing after we added private final SwerveDrivePoseEstimator poseEstimator = new SwerveDrivePoseEstimator(kinematics, new Rotation2d(), getPositions(), new Pose2d());
in lines 82 and 83. We are updating this in periodic, but we donâ€™t think we initialized the above code correctly.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-25T22:50:23.056Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":15.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493225,"topic_slug":"simulation-failing","display_username":"Justin Spurlock","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":32004,"username":"dan","name":"Dan Katzuv","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57508,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Snake51"},"post_url":"/t/simulation-failing/493225/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3540418,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T23:01:39.439Z","cooked":"
Snake51:

We donâ€™t have a this.modules at line 173 though, instead we have SwerveModulePosition[] positions = new SwerveModulePosition[modules.length];

I guess the error occurs because you access modules.length, which Java interprets as this.modules.length, but itâ€™s null. And positions maybe wasnâ€™t initialized until you called getPositions().

If this doesnâ€™t help, itâ€™s be helpful to attach a link to your code.
